subject: p10933609
History: AMS, recent ID left forearm abscess, now persistent pleuritic chest pain. New PICC line. CHEST, TWO VIEWS. Compared with, a right-sided subclavian PICC line has been placed. The tip overlies the SVC/RA junction or upper right atrium. No pneumothorax is detected. There are slightly low inspiratory volumes. The heart is not enlarged. There are patchy interstial markings predominantly in both upper lobes, similar to findings on several prior CT scans and unchanged compared with CXR. Ill-definition of both hila is likely secondary to obscuration by the interstial markings. There is minimal blunting of both costophrenic angles. No frank consolidation or gross effusion. No obvious pneumothorax. Clips noted in the upper abdomen near the GE junction.
Impression: 1 PICC line tip over SVC/RA junction or upper right atrium. If clinically indicated, this could be retracted by approximately 2 cm. 2 Chronic patchy interstial opacities both upper lobes, unchanged. 3 No new infiltrate identified.
